explanation:
Agent A is correct. In the code shown MHD_connection_finish_forward_ is defined as the no-op macro
    #define MHD_connection_finish_forward_(conn) (void)conn
so the statement
    MHD_connection_finish_forward_(urh->connection);
is an executed expression-statement that performs no side-effects. Removing that statement would not change program behaviour for the provided project configuration, which matches MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2 (dead code).

Note: if the macro is defined differently under other build configurations (i.e. it expands to code with observable effects in some builds) then in those builds the call would not be dead. The rule applies to the actual project configuration being analysed; given the definition you supplied, the call is dead code.
